body.section: Reference sets, or Refsets as they are more commonly known, are formal representations for identifying subsets of a terminology for specific purposes, and which conform to the IHTSDO's reference set specifications. Uses can include language specific termsets, value sets for constraining data element values, mappings between two terminologies, navigation support for data entry, and many other potential applications. A refset is a set of concepts, descriptions, or relationships that are appropriate to a particular language, dialect, country, specialty, organization, user or context. In its simplest form, a refset is a list of Universally Unique Identifiers (UUIDs), where each UUID refers to one component of the terminology hierarchy, and makes it a member of the refset (a refset member).

section.title: SNOMED CT Refsets
section.p: During 2008 and 2009 IHTSDO evolved their Refset specification and aligned it with the SNOMED Release Format version 2. The Refset Specification is designed to replace the earlier specification developed by the College of American Pathologists.

section.title: SNOMED CT Subsets
section.p: The original SNOMED CT Subset specification has been deemed inadequate to support the current and future requirements of IHTSDO and its affiliates. It will be deprecated over time.
